snippet: A campaign to end biomedical experiments on humans’ closest primate relatives has pulled together two federal agencies and several animal welfare groups.
abstract: Animal welfare groups celebrate decisions by National Institutes of Health and United States Fish and Wildlife Services that may come close to halting biomedical experiments on chimpanzees; NIH announced that more than 300 of 360 or so chimpanzees it owns will be retired to sanctuaries, and Fish and Wildlife Services proposes to list all chimpanzees, including those in captivity, as endangered; Dr Jane Goodall says decisions are not end of efforts to protect chimps in captivity.
lead_paragraph: A campaign to end biomedical experiments on humans’ closest primate relatives has pulled together two federal agencies and several animal welfare groups.

headline.main: Unlikely Partners, Freeing Chimps From the Lab
headline.print_headline: Unlikely Partners, Freeing Chimps From the Lab
